result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather Lynn Faltinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

timeConds.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same. Court has no objection to electronic monitoring.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heather Lynn Faltinson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Heather Lynn Faltinson in court.  Attorney Jeffrey A Jaeger in court for Heather Lynn Faltinson.  Attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Statements by Atty. Corbette; statements by Atty. Jaeger. Statements by defendant. Statements by Court; Court proceeds to sentencing.

Attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Heather Lynn Faltinson in court and by Attorney Jeffrey A. Jaeger.  Resolution reached in 22CM677 and 22TR1819.  State moves to dismiss and read in 22CM722 along with remaining citations (22FO614, 22FO615, 22TR1817, 22TR1818, 22TR1990) and Court so orders.  Counsel requests an adjourned sentencing date.  Guilty plea entered.  Court finds defendant guilty and adjourns sentencing.  Court will have 22TR1819 (OWI 1st citation) tag along for anticipated plea/sentencing on 10-28-2022.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on October 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Prosecuting Attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Heather Lynn Faltinson in court and by Attorney Jeffrey A. Jaeger.  Citations tagging along with 22CM677.  Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.
